title: Kinetically-Controlled Multivalent-Ion Pinning for Stable Blue Perovskites
description: This research proposes to develop a novel synthetic strategy combining kinetic control with multivalent ion incorporation to prevent light-induced halide phase segregation in Cs-doped quasi-2D blue perovskites, ensuring both efficient, narrow emission and long-term spectral stability.

    *   Paper 2 (by title) highlights "multivalent-effect immobilization" for "spectrally stable" deep-blue reduced-dimensional perovskites, directly addressing the stability challenge, likely through structural or defect engineering.

This immobilization is intended to "pin" the halide sublattice, thereby preventing light-induced halide migration and subsequent phase segregation, which currently undermines the spectral stability of Cs-doped blue emitters.
